security: Redaction of Social Security numbers due to privacy concerns; public disclosure of which would "constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy".
summary: This document includes payroll authorization forms and related memoranda for Paul A. DiPaolo, who joined the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff as a Research Attorney in August 1978, with Louis Stokes authorizing the action.
summary_one_paragraph: The document consists of payroll authorization forms and a memo concerning Paul A. DiPaolo's employment as a Research Attorney for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), effective August 1, 1978. It details his starting salary of $26,000 per annum and indicates his role in assisting with the preparation of the final report. The forms, authorized by Chairman Louis Stokes, include DiPaolo's social security number (redacted for privacy) and specify his termination date as December 31, 1978. The Assassination Records Review Board has postponed the release of the social security numbers due to privacy concerns.
title: Payroll Authorization for Paul A. DiPaolo, HSCA
